Reviews.Title: “In my point of view one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ziad_Adada
Reviews.Content: In my point of view one of the best hotels near the Train Station and near to center of Rome. I stayed in this hotel more than 6 times when I visit Rome in my business trip. Breakfast is more than OK. Clean, price is good for business people 2 minutes to the train station and 15 min. to pizza di spangia , Tip stay away from the rooms how are near the main road if you like to open the windows otherwise no problem you will not hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kissanpentu
Reviews.Content: The situation of this hotel is very good. The railway station is near and from the railway station it is the best way to travel to the airport. There are many many restaurants near the hotel. The staff was very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good hotel, but somewhat unremarkable.”
Reviews.Author: DavidDundonald
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but modern in terms of decor and fittings. And it's is not too pricey. Plus points - cleanliness, very friendly staff, decent bedrooms, nice and quiet, inexpensive for Rome. Low points - very poor breakfasts, pathetic lift service, boring locale, dreary bar, noisy air-con. It is certainly not a place to get excited about, but it is is safe and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located near Termine. The bedrooms are clean and the breakfast is very good. Good choice if you want to visit all turistic places ando also get in/out Rome by train.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near the central station”
Reviews.Author: nastish
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good location, approx. 5-7 minutes to the Central Train Station Termini, where you can find supermarket on the lower floor. From Genova it takes 20 minutes walk to Colosseum. The rooms are pretty different: we had one twin room on the 2nd floor with bathroom, but one double room on the same floor with a tiny shower, so my father could hardly fit it :) Breakfast is pretty reach. Don't go to Pizza restaurant (don't remember thr name), which is across Via Cavour, very touristic place with low quallity of food.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: frankenstein1961
Reviews.Content: Average rooms and staff, good breakfast and well located hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore this vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: Shelley P
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hospitality of the Genova in November for 3 nights. Valentina and the staff were wonderful in helping us make arrangments for our group of 30. The rooms were clean and comfortable. No they were not large but were everything we needed for our stay. The Breakfast was exceptional!!! With good choices of pastries and eggs, fruit, coffee and juice. Just up the street from the Santa Maggiore and the Hop on Hop off bus stop - SO HANDY. The street out front was noisy through the night - but people - this is ROME . . . it is busy and that is its charm. Can hardly wait to go back again and will recommend the Genova to anyone planning to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient place to stay in eternal Rome...”
Reviews.Author: audax
Reviews.Content: Stayed last month for the second time at this hotel for three nights. The location is very central close to the central station and the subway. So you can reach the Colosseum with two stops and also the area around the Spanish Steps (2 stops) or the museums of the Vatican (5 stops). The surrounding area is full of restaurants, bars and shops - noisy at night, so ask for a room facing the back. My room had every amenity I could wish for a three day stay and was compact, but clean and cozy. What makes this hotel special is the kind staff working here. Andrea from the reception was very kind, helpful and with a fabulous knowledge about what to see and to do in Rome - and how to do it the best way. If you want to go to the Vatican museums - go early! Don´t miss the churches San Clemente near the Colosseum and Sant Agnese fuori le mure with catacombs and the stunning Baptisterio Santa Constanza (These are in Via Nomentana, a little away from the bustle of the city). Favourite places to eat: Osteria Corsi, near Pantheon - I come there every year, it is a place, where people from Rome eat their lunch, no fuss, but good cooking! Good for dinner is Il Duello" between Piazza Navona and Pantheon in a small side street. Best ice-cream ( for me better than Giolitti ) you can enjoy at "San Crispino" with two locations near Fontana di Trevi and one around the corner from Pantheon. In summer enjoy a coffee at the terrace of the coffeshop at the roof of the Musei Capitolini. You have all of Rome beyond your feet and you will never forget this view. Back to Genova Hotel, I really recommend this for its central location and very friendly and helpful staff and I will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, definitely not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivian318
Reviews.Content: four of us( two adults and two children age 3 and 9) stayed there for three nights. The first two we had two double rooms. they are very small and harldy enough space to keep one suitcase around. They also donot have connecting rooms. We were in 1st floor(really the 2nd floor) facing the main street. We had hard time sleeping at night since we hear the metro, the street noise including half a dozen times really loud sirus in the middle of the night. i am 5'5 and 130lbs, but i can barely fiti in the shower, which gets flooded within 45 seconds. one has to clo the bathroom door to get into the shower or to use the toilet -- this tells you how small it really is. The room is quite old but ok. the third night we get a quad room which is definitely bigger, but the first room we were assigned to had terrible water leak from the ceiling, they changed us to another room in five min. The hotel is very well situated, about 5 min walk to the termini and 20 min to colosseo. Staff at the receptin desk is not very helpful but if you push harder, you may get some informatin out of them.Overall, this hotel offers convenient location but not anything near s four star hotel. We paid 280 euro for the quad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Skye-mother
Reviews.Content: Close to the train and bus terminal, and metro stop. Numerous restaurants and stores surrounding the hotel. The staff were very helpful with arranging transportation from the airport and to the cruise ship port. Very nice breakfast area with a good selection of items to chose from. Breakfast is included in the cost of the room. Our room was large and the bathroom was spacious with a nice deep bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: richard v
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend and got an amazing holiday.The staff were friendly specially Andrea who was charming and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Almost no internet”
Reviews.Author: 1garrygee
Reviews.Content: In this day and age internet is no longer just a nice thing to have. At this hotel for 5 Euros an hour you could get poor internet connection at the far end of the lobby. It was not available in your room. I was occasionally able to get better access from surrounding hotels. It was maddening. The weekend staff, when we arrived were very rude. The weekday staff was better. I was part of a tour group and didn't have a choice about where I stayed, otherwise I would have been out of there after my second trip up three flights of stairs with the wrong key to my room. The lobby always smelled like smoke and it was up the stairs in the morning. Nothing else to do at night I guess. I would not go back or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take you ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Maria433
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, two then another night a week later. The check in person was freindly but tried to tell us that a lot of the restaurants were closed because it was the hoildays so he would book us in to make sure we got in. Well there was a least 10 eating places in an easy walk all open and all with room. TOURIST ARE NOT STUPID. The room was very small and the bathroom could only fit one person in at a time. In fact the shower was the smallest shower we had ever used and difficult to get into. Via Cavour is a main road in Rome and the sound proofing was not up to the noise, so take earplugs. The breakfast was very good but the trolley coming through to collect dirty plates and scraping food into a container was unpleasant and unnecessary. I asked for room away from the main road for our second visit but they gave us the same side and argued with me that I had asked for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Your Money. 很好的旅馆，早餐超棒！ 地点很方便，离中心火车站（也是地铁站）很近。”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusUrbanLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. The overall experience is great. The breakfast are the best among three hotels for our Italy trip; the other two were in Florence and Venice. It had the largest food selection, the eating areas are very pleasant. We really missed this breakfast when we moved to Florence and Venice (the later one is the worst of the worst). However, it seems unlike in U.S.A., waiter/waitress constantly take the dirty plates immediately after you finish that dish, so you can have space for your next round. This hotel's waiter/waitress don't clean it until you complete your entire breakfast. We were not like it because their table is not very big unless two people take two tables. The location of this hotel is very, very convenient. It close to the central train station and you can go anywhere from there. It's only 5-10 minutes of walking to the station and it's very safe. We went out for dinner every evening and normally return to hotel around 10 pm. we never felt unsafe in any sense. If you want to get a quick bite for dinner, walk to the train station (5-10 minutes walking), the food court offers some special deals for a set of meal, very reasonable priced. But the restaurant hotel suggested to us is great, no regret at all. Actually, there is another restaurant closed to the one they suggested, and the waiter was very handsome and very pushy (always pull seat and nod to you, then tell you something like, "come on, this seat is just for you..."). One night, we were attracted by the waiter (I said he is handsome :-)) and sat down. Please don't make this same mistake, this restaurant with handsome waiters is not good at all. Their food is not comparable to the one that hotel suggested us (this one's waiters are older and more professional), not at all. One thing we didn't like -- the bathroom is too small. The bidet seat takes too much space and I really like they take the bidet out and make the shower space bigger. Another thing is their hand towels. I don't think those towels are cotton. They have good looking but not useable because it can't really dry hands after wash. Besides, the hand towels and bidet seat towels are EXACTLY the same. Therefore just think about it -- your hand towels could be last guest's butt towels! We didn't want to touch it at all. So, think it before you use.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: janice_in_pcola
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from a wonderful 9 day European trip, and our last city was Rome. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and loved it. When we first checked in , Adel at the front desk was just wonderful.. he was very helpful and nice, providing us with a map and suggesting restaurants close by. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Lots of great cafe's and little shops within just a couple of block range from the hotel. Our room was on the top floor and we had a wonderful balcony. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was by far the best we had while in Europe. I would definitely suggest this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Enid_11
Reviews.Content: AC was not on at the end of April (75 degrees).Mattress and pillows are very,very hard.Do not take room in front of the hotel, very noisy.Day staff good, night staff rude. Not a 4 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not do good”
Reviews.Author: rohitgoel82
Reviews.Content: hotel genova rome . its a ok hotel with great location next to the railway station . a small hotel with bad breakfast not many option to eat.and the staff dont speak english . after u have finish talking to them they will speak sumething in there language as if they are making fun of you. also they dont have english channels to see except bbc or cnn which is the worst part.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: Danelady2
Reviews.Content: I believe the hotel is overrated. It was the largest room we had for our entire trip to Europe, which included several countries. However the shower was so small you can barely move. The attention our room received in 5 days was minimal. We could not even get clean glasses. The hotel staff was indifferent to needs and inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As Some of the Reviews But...”
Reviews.Author: lexyluvsny
Reviews.Content: Make sure you find Claudio! The other staff at the desk weren't as helpful as him. I needed someone to confirm one of my tours. I was doing a lot of tours and didn't have time - I'd leave too early or get in too late. Well my tour wasn't confirmed - Claudio called and they told him they couldn't find me on their list. There was a lot of bickering among the staff in Italian about this (after I mentioned how I had spoken to the attendant the day before and asked him to confirm). Claudio DID try to get me another tour similar to the one I missed and he was sincerely sorry for the mishap. The kicker of this story is I checked out then went to breakfast and as I was leaving to the train station - an employee hands me a "fax" - on top was what looked like one of those sales/time share faxes you get. On the train I look through the fax and it was SEVERAL faxes starting the 18th from the tour company trying to tell me the tour had been cancelled and trying to reschedule me!! That is NO way to run a busines. Obviously the person never "confirmed" my trip and giving a customer faxes several days AFTER the fact?? And I do have to agree about no internet - I was in Florence and Lake Como and had NO problems with internet there. Overall though - hotel was clean, the room was clean and a decent size by European standards. I was alone and not too worried about the location. It seemed a busy street and there were always people (tourists & regular people) around and a store or 2 opened. The breakfast was fine - when you're getting the free breakfast you can't expect a feast. It's ALWAYS a lot of carbs - even in the US. Avoid the little shop on the side of the hotel though - they sell gelato and sandwiches. I grabbed a sandwich one day and it had WAY too much mayo. I went to take some off and there was almost NO meat on the sandwich. It looked like they had taken a 1/2 slice of ham and cut it in triangles to LOOK like meat. Not to mention there was some "confusion" over the posted prices.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost...”
Reviews.Author: Jacquieh41
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned today from Hotel Genova and I could not wait to post my review. This hotel is in no way, shape or form a four star hotel, whoever rated it as such such be FIRED. Before leaving we assumed all the reviews were exaggerating, they were not. In terms of location, you are within walking distance to the Colosseum, great food and sights, that is the only plus. We were unfortunately placed in a room facing the street, the noise was UNBEARABLE, the room was so hot, all that was missing was sand and a margarita!!, even with AC it was difficult to sleep. We were there for 4 days, no clean sheets, the same stains that were there when we arrived were still there four days later. Do not be fooled with the pictures online, we were learn from us. Pros: location and breakfast, Cons: noisiness, poor AC, internet 20 euros a day, beds, items missing (use the safe) dirty. There is an old saying "if you fail to hear, sometimes you need to feel" that will bode you well, if you fail to listen to the reviews. For those who had a great time and the service was everything you wanted, great. For us, it was extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some things to critize according to the price”
Reviews.Author: vale_izzo
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. It's a very nice hotel, very clean and has beautiful decoration. Breakfast is great and personnel is really kind. It's well located in terms of distance to the main attractions but it's close to Termini station, which zone is not the best in Rome. I got to the hotel before 2 pm and my room was ready! That was fantastic! There are three things that I'd improve about this hotel. First, it's a 4 star hotel. It should have internet included in the rate. They charge you an expensive price per hour to access internet and it's not even wi fi (wi fi only in the lobby). Also, the noise of the rooms is a problem. My room was next to a noisy family's room, and it was connected by a door so I could hear every single noise from them (every noise). I lived my life according to the family's life (every morning they woke me up and I could not sleep until they went to bed). The last thing, is that I asked for a single room. It was fantastic, really big for me but had a single bed, very tiny! There was space to incllude a bigger bed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coccole73
Reviews.Content: We staied at the Hotel Genova for a week and and we had absolutely a lovely stay. Our room was very spacious and spotless. The bed was big and very confortable. Although we got there way before check in time the receptionist did her best and managed to give the room earlier than expected. The hotel is located just minutes walk from Termini train and bus station and within walking distance from the Colosseum. I would definitly reccomend the hotel Genova, both for business and leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the pictures”
Reviews.Author: bearnup
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT a 4 star hotel...not even close! The breakfast was the worst we had in Europe. The muesli was like cardboard. The coffee was undrinkable. The room was small for 3 people. The photos on the website make the rooms look much better & better than they are. The extra bed was in such bad condition we had to cover its dirty bed head with a towel.The walls were dirty. There was no way to control the room temperature. It was so hot in the room its was hard to sleep & if you opened the window it was so noisy you couldn't sleep & this was in the middle of winter! They charged 10 Euros for the internet & there was no wireless connection! Most of the hotels we stayed at provided free internet access. To top off our stay as we were leaving the concierge told us to use 'their' car for 50 euros to get to the airport because taxis, who have a 40 euro flat fee to the airport, charge for luggage. This was a lie and we had a great taxi driver who didn't charge us for luggage or the story of his life. The concierge was reluctant to cancel our booking for the car until I insisted. Then he gave our taxi driver a 'daggered' stare. One of the concierges was great & helpful, the others were just doing a job. This stay for us was supposed to be spoiling ourselves at the end of our holiday. It was so disappointing I felt impelled to share our experience to warn others

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Stas911
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly staff, great location (3 min from Termini metro and railways), good breakfast. First room provided was deeply smoked with terrible smell - confirm the non-smoking room if it's required. After our claim it was quickly replaced for non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-well connected”
Reviews.Author: Jatin_Trivedi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in excellent location - very close to station and walking distance to most of the sight seeing spots in Rome. It is well connected through metro and buses to most of the farway sight seeing places like Vatican. The area around the hotel is always buzzing till late night. There are lot of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel BUT at most a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: ritmatsi
Reviews.Content: Too noisy room (by the Via Cavour). Too small shower (perfect only for children) without the right lighting. The first day we found out that our towels were hung on bathroom radiator which unfortunately had 2 inches dust (unbelievable!!!). Last day while doing our last check before leaving the room we found out that also under the bed there was 2 inches dust/fuzz. We assume the last time they cleaned it was one or two months ago (unbelievable!!!). Unacceptable breakfast for a 4 start hotel. No variety at all. Perfect for diet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly63
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Genova is perfect for site seeing. Rail and bus lines only a block away. Most major tourist sites within walking distance other on the metro line again only a block away. Hop on Hop off bus at the train station as well. Food is everywhere so no excuse not to eat well. Breakfast at the Hotel very good with great attendents as well a wonderful front desk staff and porters. Having a rail pass gives you more options. Pompei, Sorrento, Florence only an hour or so away.

Reviews.Title: “A little overpriced, but nice!”
Reviews.Author: AlineGIL
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very good service, nice room. The location is very good, close the the Termini Station. I was happy with my stay there, although I think It´s overpriced for what it offers. The only thing I have to complain abou is the size of the shower... My husband is 1,93m tall and it was not easy for him... see the fotos attached. Other than that, is a good place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: Pros: very clean, good breakfast, great bed. Cons: too close to the railway station - which is not a perfect location to roam around when it gets dark, shower was not so good, room rate was quite high. Overall, it's a good place to stay at if you are staying for 1 night, leaving by train next day!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Genova - You Get What You Pay For - Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Tolbert
Reviews.Content: Hotel Genova is an easy walk conveniently located three blocks from the Central Rome Train Station. Comfortable stay. Some general observations. Firstly, the location. Having the train station and the local metro near by made for convenient transitting around the city. Unlike Florence and some of the other major tourist sites in Italy, Rome is huge. Unless you like to hoof it, take the metro to get to the sites. Easy to understand the maps and stations. Secondly, the service at times (depending on who was working) was somewhat suspect. The Front Desk staff seemed indifferent to our requests. Additionally, it was easier to go to the front desk for service vice using the telephone to call. No one answered each time I called. And surprisingly, we found it somewhat odd that we had more difficulty speaking English to the staff here in Rome than when we were in Florence. While we stayed at the Hotel Genova we experienced no hot water on one morning, a power outage, computers were down, and the obligatory Communist demonstration which proceeded in front of the hotel. Along those same lines, being in the central part of the city, you can expect to enjoy the noise from the street. Fortunately, the rooms were equipped with shudders and windows that blocked the noises at night time. Eating - When you're not sure of restaurants in the area, talk to the Bartender (not sure of his name) who kind of acted as a Concierge. Although the restaurants weren't close by, his recommendations were spot on. Rely on him to point you in the right direction. A general observation about travelling around Rome seeing the sites: Regardless of the time or date, get used to standing in lines (especially at the Vatican and Colisseum). Strongly recommend you go on-line and purchase your Vatican Museum tickets before-hand so that you don't have to wait in lines that wrap around the Vatican walls. Another thing about lines: if you have a tour in front of you, hunker down and enjoy the wait. Because they won't move, step aside, or make an effort to let you walk by. And, if you are lucky, they will share their sneezes with you without covering their mouths or using a tissue. But, the trade off from these inconveniences is marvelling at the Sistine Chapel, St. Peters, Colisseum, Roman Forum and Spanish Steps (to name a few). Unbelievable! Back to Hotel Genova. Bottom line observation: We would recommend this hotel. Give it a shot. The quality of the hotel and location make the other inconveniences tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Average Hotel, clean, good food, ideal for holiday”
Reviews.Author: GriffinFamily4
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor, previous reviews were spot on

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't worth its money”
Reviews.Author: uoa2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 days in August of 2010 and almost every day there was a different problem to tackle !!! Don't get carried away by the hotel pics on the official website. First of all the bathroom and the shower cabin, in particular, was dirty with permanent stains all over the place (the attached pictures speak for themselves...) and the sheets of the bed we were sleeping in weren't changed once during our whole stay (except from the pillow cases !!). On the third day of our stay the maid forgot even to tidy our beds or empty the waste basket in the bathroom !!! And she wouldn't have come at all if we hadn' t complained at the reception desk. On the last night of our stay we came back to our room late at night only to find out that it smelled like someone had been smoking... When we...yet again... complained about the smell we were told that there must have been a malfunction of the airconditioning system and that the only solution possible was to tranfer to another room. But we decided not to, because being already too tired, we couldn't possibly pack our things and move to another room in the middle of the night. The easiest solution was to go to sleep and forget all about it ; after all, we were leaving the next day. All of the above would be expected if we had picked a cheap hotel, but with 110 euros per night, it's tottaly unexceptable !!! Final advice : Don't go there... !!!

Reviews.Title: “All that you need when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KathyVH10
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome late in the evening and caught the shuttle bus from the airport to the central Termini having noticed the signs advertising this service from the baggage collection area. Cost was 8 Euro only per person. Very cheap and easy to locate. The Hotel Genova is one block only away from the Termini. The Termini is also where you can catch the 'on/ off' open top bus services that tour the city. You have a few companies to choose from, average price 20 Euro for one day, 30 Euro for 2 days. From the Termini you can also catch the local bus service to Trastevari. An old area of the city not to be missed for an eating experience. Consequently the Hotel Genova is excellently located for all of your transport needs. We stayed for 3 nights and had a room that faced the main road. We had no problem with street noise, windows were closed and the airconditioning provided good relief from the heat of the day outside. We slept soundly, comfortably and undisturbed. Rooms were spotlessly clean and house keeping was attended to daily. Breakfast was excellent. Fresh juices, bread/rolls (really good) and pastries, cheese, meats, cereals, fruit, herbal teas and coffee served in a brightly lit eating area with staff on hand at all times. There is also a cosy bar and outdoor garden area that all looks new. Staff were attentive and willing to help organise taxis etc. Internet access in rooms had to be paid for at 5 Euros for one hour. (Since leaving Rome, we have had wireless service for free in our other hotels). We found a laundromat within walking distance that provided internet access, a cheaper option for using the net as the laundry was done. We really enjoyed Rome and having scanned trip advisor in search of accommodation options, were more than pleased with Hotel Genova. We found Otel.com the cheapest option when booking and paid $518 US (breakfast included) for the 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ambeltran
Reviews.Content: The Good - Right in the middle of everything, A lot of attractions within walking distance, nice accomodations, Continental Breakfast almost good (US standards) The Bad - If you get a room with street views it is noisy 24 hours (we were so tired by the time we got back that it didn't bother us too much). From day one I took a cup of coffee back to our room and left it there. It stayed in our room for 3 days and we could never figure out why they would not take it since the housekeeping was up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new rooms, but in a noisy location”
Reviews.Author: IncantatoTours
Reviews.Content: At the Genova it makes a huge difference which side of the hotel your room is facing as being so close to Termini station also means you have to deal with or hear the traffic noise that hardly calms down at night. The hotel has recently been renovated and the new rooms are nicely decorated and feature many ammenities. Breakfast is not bad, lots or prepacked items, but of a good quality. If you can get a great deal and are not a light sleeper, this is a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable beds, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DixonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and were very happy with the location and comfort of the rooms. The beds were comfortable and rooms nicely appointed. The breakfast was fine and had a good selection. My only caution is that the staff seemed very tied into making recommendations for poor quality expensive restaurants and limo services. It is obvious that they are getting a kickback. I just wouldn't ask their opinion. Delicious restaurant on the sidewalk across the street-- full 3 cours meals for 12 euro (including a soda). The hotel staff thought it was horrible, we loved it--no kick back I assume.

Reviews.Title: “So Pleseantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: 1luvtotravel
Reviews.Content: I had reserved this hotel initially becuase I had liked the pictures of the property itself, but was a little scared after reading various reviews about the rooms being extremely small, with no functioning A/C. To our surprise the room was not HUGE but a good size for our family of 3, I mean come on we're not planning on dancing a waltz in there. The location was excellent only a couple of blocks away from Termini where you could catch the Metro or any bus you'd like. Breakfast was good, a wide selection of items continuosly being replenished. Beds were good a little harder than the one at home but no bed ever feels like the one at home. Room and bathroom were both very clean. Shampoo and soap were left for us daily. I would definately return here if returning to Rome and would most definately recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: feedbackthetruth
Reviews.Content: After checking in at 1pm we were told to come back at 3pm with the flick of a hand. Such was the standard of service at the front desk. As it was raining I asked if we could borrow an umbrella and was told to buy one outside from the very gypsies I had tried to avoid coming down from Termini. The room was nice with a big veranda however the fridge leaked and didn't work. You could also hear the subway from the 3rd floor. Check in was even worse later when we were left standing with no direction or room key. The location is handy to the main station however this hotel is not worth the price we paid. Definitely not 4 star service. Oh by the way the breakfast staff acted like they were cleaning out dog kennels during the busy breakfast rush and banged and slammed bowls and plates with a permanent look of disdain and disinterest. One male staff yelled at a customer who was trying to use the automatic coffee machine (really bad tasting coffee by the way.) I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: PhilWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: With one exception, my wife and I were completely satisfied with Hotel Genova and would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to others. The exception to which I refer concerned the room temperature. The hotel is on a noisy street but with the windows and shutters closed there is complete silence and darkness. However the A/C had not yet been furned on in Mid-march so although the outside air was cool (40 during the night and 60's) durring the day), the room was a bit stuffy at times during the night with everything shut although we were able to turn the ventilation fan turn on for a little breeze. The hotel is convenient, modern, spotlessly clean, has an outstanding breakfast and breakfast room and a room refridgerator . The price was very reasonable and much cheaper than other big cities. There are many restaurants nearby, and transportation from Fuimicino airport consisted of a train ride to Termini and a short walk to the hotel with no stairs or other obstacles. The two subway lines are several hundred feet from the hotel lobby as well as numerous bus lines and a trollel line. If you want to buy beer, wine, cheese, bread, etc. to eat in your room there are two full service groceries nearby, one in Termini (with the name Drug Store!) and one across from the front entrance to Santa Maria Maggiori. Many other smaller stores are even closer. We ate at several good nearby restaurants but can't remember the names. Unlike Paris, they don't have several menus with different price levels depending upon where you sit. Everybody just about everywhere was friendly, efficient, honest, and of course spoke English. For example, we ate a very nice Chinese restaurant near Santa Maria Maggiore and the Germans in the next table were taking to the Chinese hosts in English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: forjas
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip to rome for a year. I read all reviews about the hotel Genova so I wasn't really sure what we would find when we got there. I've got to say I was pleasantly suprised, the hotel was very nice, the room spacious and clean. The bathroom was big with bathtub and shower combo. Our room was in the front of the hotel the noise from traffic could get a bit loud, we closed the window and put the a/c on. The front desk was helpful. They also provided breakfast each day. The location couldn't be better, just 2 blocks from termini station, buses, trains, metro and the hop on hop off buses. It's also walking distance to most attractions. There are resturants everywhere around the hotel. The best was Tudini's on Cavour the food was fabulous and the prices were decent. If your looking for a hotel with a convienent location to attractions and resturants this it.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: fin1813
Reviews.Content: After staying in 2 hotels near the Colliseum, which were less than what we had expected, we checked into the Genova and immediately were relieved. The hotel is situated near the Termini Station which was terrific for us as we travelled around the city each day by metro and left by train to the airport. The hotel has had a major renovation so everything is new, modern and fresh. The staff were friendly and helpful and when we arrived in our room, there was one bed, not two as we had requested, so they arranged for us to go to another room, which was large, spacious and airy. The rooms are large, with high celings, wooden floors and very comfortable. The bathroom was also large, with big windows to allow light and fresh air. Bedroom and bathroom had shutters that completely blocked all light for sleep. We looked forward to breakfast each morning as the range and quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: barbaraann1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights the staff were very friendly and helpful.Room was kept clean although not to big it was about normal for a city stay.We were at the front of the hotel so there was a lot of traffic noise but not too bad overnight with window closed(there was air-con) The breakfast was very nice and a good start to the day.It is only 5 minute walk from main station and bus station so easy to get around.Just up the road from the collassium surprising how close things are together.There are some nice places to eat near by if you don't want to wander to far in the evenings after a long day. We had a wonderful time although beware with the euro it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, over rated, NOT FOR CAT SWINGERS”
Reviews.Author: ROVing_9
Reviews.Content: Arrived and 'greeted' by the rudest manager ever. Given a room a child would struggle to move around in let alone 2 adults. The bed was very hard, walls covered in scuff marks and a shower you could hardly move in. The floors had not been cleaned prior to us arriving and were not washed in 5 days. The breakfast was adequate. The staff did not make us feel welcome. Would NOT stay again and would definately not recomend to friends I wanted to keep.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: DennisB12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Genova. The hotel is on Via Cavour, which is a busy and well traveled street, so it can be a bit noisy at times. However, being close to the train station and a large number of restaurants, it's a pretty nice location. We found the people at the hotel to be helpful, but a bit cold at times. They gave us some nice recommendations, but weren't as willing to spend time explaining the area or give advice on where to go as other European hotels that we have stayed at. We found it quite odd that we were required to leave the key to our room at the front desk and ask for it every time when we came back in. We thought this could be a bit of a security problem because they didn't require ID or any information to request the key for a specific room. The air conditioning wasn't very powerful in our room -- it got quite hot and leaving the window open wasn't a great option because of the noise. The rooms were small, but nice. The breakfast was great and the overall appearance of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but quiet noisy”
Reviews.Author: pinkpumkin
Reviews.Content: The location is central, a 5 min walk from the roma termini, very easy to locate, and the hotel was nice and clean. However the room was quiet small and very noisy specially at night, could clearly hear a metro train rumble by every half an hour or so. the breakfast was nice too. Overall the hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased to recommend as an ideally siuated ,comfortable hotel with helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rygbigogledd
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Genova as part of a group of 66 from Pwllheli ,Wales to support Wales in our quest for the Six Nations Rugby champioship.The location was ideal.Central for all the sights and a myriad choice of restaurant and bars within walking distance.We arrived earlier than expected but received a courteous and helpful welcome from all the staff.Rooms were released ealry and all queries answered graciously by the patient reception staff.The rooms were comfortable and clean and the breakfast filled the spot.I would be happy to return. NB.Wales just about won the match.

Reviews.Title: “Just For Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ZUZUNITA
Reviews.Content: The location of Genova is one of the best cause is exactly next to stazione termini(6min by foot)and there u can take bus or metro for the whole rome.Rooms are quite good but nothing so impressive.I suggest to choose one from4th or 5th floor cause metro stops after midnight so the noise from it ,will be a problem for sleeping DURING THE DAY.Bathroom and general the room was clean and lady who had the responsibility of cleaning was more than good.Breakfast have much of dry food(rusks,cornflakes,honey or jam in small plastic,biscuit)and less of fresh things such as cheese or italian ham,eggs,juice,milk,cakes etc. Restaurrunt only for breakfast not dinner or lunch. Best characteristic of genova is the place of it.U can go to piazza republica-vittorio emmanuele monument-santa maria magiore by foot. Of course value for money will be reasonable but could be better in future this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwedenMarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near the Roma Termini Railway station, so its a good location if you need to take the train in the morning. The hotel is situated on a very busy street, so unless you get a room at the back of the hotel or on a high floor, you will be disturbed by the traffic all through the night. The hotel is definitely NOT cosy and gives a sterile and cold impression. Also, the man at the front desk did not experience his best day. The room we got was clean and the bed was OK but it was very dark. Additionally, there was a strange odor of perfume in the room. All in all, we will not return to this hotel and one night was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: The location is great - one can actually see the hotel from the intersection outside of the Termini. I stayed 4 nights in total - 2 nights on a Friday and Saturday and 2 nights at the end of the following week on Thursday and Friday. The room for the first 2 nights was unexpectedly spacious with high ceilings. Not what I expect for a Europe hotel. The bed was very big. The bathroom was lush with marble floors. The room for the last 2 nights were smaller than the first one despite at a more expensive rate. The bed was the same size as the bigger room. Overall, this is a modern hotel at a very good price. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Genova”
Reviews.Author: Appius
Reviews.Content: I look for a hotel near Termini station because it is pretty central and, more importantly, because taking a bus or subway from Termini, you can get to anywhere in the city rapidly e.g. bus direct to St. Peter's or metro to Colosseum. I got what I thought was a good deal in Hotel Genova ($150 a night) though it was August of course. My room was pleasant and comfortable with good AC and was reasonable spacious. Bed was a little firm but OK. The bathroom was spacious and beautifully decorated with marble tiling. The shower, in contrast, was a triangular corner design and was really too tight (and I'm not big). I could see Americanus Magnus having some considerable difficulty manouvering in it. Linen face towels were provided. The breakfast was very modest, consisting largely of standardised and packaged items, machine coffee etc. There are some nice restaurants particularly on the Via Principe Amadeo which cuts across the Via Cavour and shops in the Termini station stay open late. On Sundays or Church holidays, Latin Mass with Gregorian Chant in nearby Sancta Maria Maggiore is an elevating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fairly clean”
Reviews.Author: Zbezial
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights between May and June 2008. The Hotel is renovated and looks nice. The welcome at the reception was poor to fair, we arrived at 8:30 a.m. and were told that the room was not ready and we should come back at 10 or 11 a.m. that was not so nice. The room was OK big bed and a smaller one. The room was clean but don't look under the bed. The sheets were clean. The bathroom has no bathtub but it's ok. The AC was working nice. the location is very good a 4 minutes walk to Santa Maria Maggiore, 4 minutes to Roma Termini were you can take the bus or train anywhere. and 6 minutes walk to Piazza del Republica. Starting midnight you might encounter some crak junkies in the back streets around the hotel, but we never had a security problem. Overall it was not bad. Just don'r expect a nice welcome and don't be too picky concerning cleaning and dusting and everything will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience. Would Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: notworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Italian vacation. Overall, Hotel Genova was the best of any we stayed at in Rome, Florence and Venice. We had a very large triple by European standards. The bathroom was also pretty lush, with marble throughout. Everything was very clean and seemed very new. The front desk staff was very helpful at directing us toward sights in the morning when we were ready to leave. The hotel also had a "full" breakfast, but the only difference between a full breakfast and a continental one was the presence of slightly runny eggs. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel. Being right by Termini was a great location because of the proximity to public transportation and the ability to get out of the city easily. The area was sort of quiet at night (there were only a few restaurants in the area that stayed open past 11pm), but we enjoyed being a little bit away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: china2008London
Reviews.Content: great syay given short notice, just turned up after poor experience at the 'Daphne' B&B. Genova good value for money, helpful staff no signs of construction as reviewed! clean contempory hotel, would definatley stay there again. Denne

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bubbles83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Genova in September 07. I had read some mixed reviews about the hotel and did have doubts in my mind. However, I could not have been more wrong! The hotel was clean and tidy, with modern finishes. The breakfast was good and the room and bathroom was perfect (small as most European rooms are). The hotel was a short walk from the train station and about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_Teles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Genova was going under restoration by the time my husband and I arrived, but it was no big deal. In fact, since we enjoyed the hotel despite that, one can imagine how good it will be after all the work is done. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, with modern decoration, and well sized (not big, as usual). Great, beautiful bathroom (tiny shower area, though). It's located near Termini (Rome's biggest train station) - not too close as to be disturbed by the crowd and close enough to make it easy to get transportation (subway, bus, trains to other cities). Also walking-distance from Santa Maria Maggiore church. Breakfast is good enough; the building is functional, organized. Some members of the staff could be more friendly. There is one good restaurant just around the corner (called Galina Bianca), but be aware about the other ones in that area (very tourist-oriented, with poor food and wine). We would go back to Hotel Genova, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: londonowl
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was a bit concerned as to what I might find after reading some of the reviews. However, I had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet (although admitedly I was at the back of the hotel). The hotel staff were also very willing to offer help.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: josieWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: I had 3 rooms in a week. The noise from the street was such that I thought WWIII was going on on the other side of the glass. I was first given such a tiny room with such a tiny bathroom that I could not envision spending 7 nights in this rathole. I asked for a larger room which was given to me not without the employee at the desk showing his displeasure... the second room was bigger, but also noisier, so they finally ( 2 nights later) gave us a fairly large room which was not as noisy. The rooms are dark, the bathrooms are dark. Not many lights anywhere. It was hot, and they gave us a few hours of a/c one night. The rest of the time it was hot, hot, hot, and of course you could not open the windows lest you wanted to lose your hearing. Breakfast was barely edible. Staff grumpy and condescending. Hotel looked terrible since it is being restaured. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: speaktruly
Reviews.Content: Short walk (200 metres) to the Central Railway ,many restaurants, laundrette ,supermarket,etc, and healthy walk to much sightseeing. On noisy main road but we were moved to quiet rear room after complaining. Rooms pretty dark/dingy but bigger than a lot in Europe.Breakfast quiet OK, not a huge range but you wont get too bored or hungry . We found staff at reception in particular very helpful and went out of their way to pack us (wife & I) a breakfast pack due to our early departure on a tour . Renovations badly needed and now being carried out but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE Genova”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have pictures to prove it. Lobby and dining area appear to be damaged by fire based on large holes and black burns. The fire exits on every floor are blocked or lead to dead ends. Emergency Exit signs will guide you to dead end hallways and doors blocked by NEW drywall. One of two stairways is completely blocked by construction and plastic with scaffolds. Elevator trapped us and was broken several days. We had 5 rooms and all were filthy. Mold was in all bathrooms, on walls, ceiling, windows, and showers. You will leave sick from the dust and smell. They apologized because they have NO rooms in the entire building that are no smoking. The building is under complete construction and they told us not to expect it to be finished for over another year. They warned us NOT to walk outside the building after dark, but everyone in Rome eats after dark?? Taxis refused to pick us up on three occasions after the front desk called and we waited almost one hour before deciding to walk or take the Metro. See photos. I have plenty more that are even worse. Telephones in the rooms may have worked in the 1950's?

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer relations”
Reviews.Author: muzzy
Reviews.Content: The staff were the most unhelpful people i have encountered, they went out of there way to make life difficult. The cooked breakfast was cold even at 0700hrs in the morning and the decor was depressing. The location was ideal for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is on a noisy street”
Reviews.Author: ariel408
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is nice. Location is convenient but noisy. Construction was going on during my visit in May 2004 so that may have made it worse than usual.

Reviews.Title: “A decent option”
Reviews.Author: hamerg
Reviews.Content: The traffic on busy Via Cavour can be disturbing if you're sensitive to noise, but otherwise this hotel is a decent option. Nothing will amaze, but nothing is bad either. The location isn't the absolute best available, but it is still pretty good, with Termini close-by and you can walk to the majority of attractions within 20 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about but....”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_TEE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Genova in February 2004. I was traveling alone and was glad the hotel was centrally located to the termini and alot of the important monuments and site-seeing areas. There was a good variety of cuisine as well. The rooms were clean, but in need of redecorating [somewhat depressing atmosphere, but I really didn't spend alot of time in mine], the breakfast was boring after the first morning, and the hotel staff wasn't very helpful, but all in all, this hotel got the job done.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Genova
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour 33, 00184 Rome, Italy
